alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 30 at 2:10PM PST until January 31 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .A strong atmospheric river is expected to bring heavy rain Tuesday evening through early Thursday morning bringing six to ten inches of rainfall across the area. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Southwestern Humboldt. * WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...There will be an increased risk of rock and land slides along roadways. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. This may include flooding of the Mattole River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Six to ten inches of rain is expected tonight through Wednesday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
